benchmark_details.name: VisText-Mosquito
benchmark_details.overview: VisText-Mosquito is a multimodal dataset integrating visual and textual data to support automated detection, segmentation, and reasoning for mosquito breeding site analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for automated detection, segmentation, and reasoning on mosquito breeding sites.

data.source: Collected images from various mosquito breeding habitats across Bangladesh, annotated for object detection and segmentation.
data.size: 1,828 images for object detection, 142 images for water surface segmentation
data.annotation: Manual annotation using the Roboflow platform, includes bounding boxes and segmentation masks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on standard evaluation protocols for detection and generation tasks.
methodology.interpretation: High values in metrics indicate better performance in detecting mosquito breeding sites and generating coherent reasoning.
methodology.baseline_results: YOLOv9s: mAP@50 of 0.92891 for object detection; YOLOv11n-Seg: mAP@50 of 0.79795 for segmentation; Mosquito-LLaMA3-8B: BLEU score of 54.7.
methodology.validation: The models were validated using a split of the dataset into training, validation, and testing sets.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Anonymization techniques applied to protect sensitive location details.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Permission obtained from local authorities and property owners.
